**Project Cost of Capital with Comparable Firm**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)

set.seed(16)
beta_comp <- rnorm(1, mean = 1.2, sd = 0.05)
rf <- 0.025
mkt_prem <- 0.065
```

Aurora Technologies is evaluating a new project. The closest comparable firm (all-equity financed) has an equity beta of `r round(beta_comp,2)`.
The risk-free rate is `r round(rf*100,2)`% and the expected market risk premium is `r round(mkt_prem*100,1)`%.

::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault();" style="display:flex;flex-direction:row;gap:6px;"> <label for="module4_num_q16a"><strong>1. What is the project’s cost of capital (in %)?</strong></label> <input type="number" id="module4_num_q16a" name="module4_num_q16a" placeholder="Enter value" style="width:150px;" data-correct-answer=`r round((rf + beta_comp*mkt_prem)*100,2)` data-tolerance="0.1"/> </form> <div id="feedback-module4_num_q16a" class="feedback" style="display:none;"> ✅ Cost of capital = r<sub>f</sub> + β × (Market premium) = **`r round((rf + beta_comp*mkt_prem)*100,2)`**%. </div>
